title: InoBat Auto signs declarations of intent with Spain for construction of new EV battery manufacturing plant
notes:
Location:
- The project is planned to be located in Valladolid, in the Castilla y León region of Spain. InoBat is also considering other strategic sites in the United Kingdom for its Western European gigafactory.

Capacity:
- N/A

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- InoBat has signed protocols and declarations of intent with the Spanish authorities for the construction of the new production facility in Valladolid, Spain. The decision on the location for its Western European gigafactory is expected to be made before the end of the year.

Project type:
- The project is a new build for the construction of a new production facility in Valladolid, Spain.

Value chain stages:
- N/A

title: InoBat Auto and Ideanomics reveal plans to build R&D and battery production facilities in Indiana, USA, supported by the State of Indiana
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Indiana, USA.

Capacity:
- The initial annual production capacity of the battery module and pack assembly plant is 100 MWh, with plans to expand to an initial 2-3 GWh yearly production capacity for the full commercial-scale battery module and pack assembly plant. There is also exploration of a potential tailor-made battery cell production facility with an initial 4 GWh annual capacity.

Investment amounts:
- The project is supported by the State of Indiana, which is providing administrative, advisory, fiscal, and site location support. The Indiana Economic Development Corporation is committed to the project and is looking to identify sites and negotiate a potential incentive package.

Project progress:
- The project is in the phase of planning and initial investment, with the announcement of the partnership and the intention to open a new R&D and production facility for battery module and pack assembly. The construction of the full commercial-scale battery module and pack assembly plant is also part of the planned phases.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new battery module and pack R&D and prototype-volume production facility, as well as a full commercial-scale battery module and pack assembly plant.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of battery module and pack assembly, and there is exploration of a potential tailor-made battery cell production facility, which would cover cell manufacturing.

Please note that the information provided is based on the articles and may not include the most recent developments.

title: InoBat to build battery factory in Valladolid
notes:
Location:
- InoBat Auto has signed a letter of intent with Spanish authorities to build a factory in Valladolid. However, the company is also considering other locations in Western Europe, including the UK.

Capacity:
- InoBat has a pilot plant with 100 MWh that has been put into operation. A planned production facility with 10 GWh is also in progress in Slovakia.

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- InoBat plans to make a final decision on the location of its battery factory in Western Europe later this year. The signing of the letters of intent is intended to ensure that if Spain is selected, InoBat will have the necessary permits and government support to move the project forward quickly.

Project type:
- The project in Spain is in the stage of signing a letter of intent, indicating a new build.

Value chain stages:
- The article does not provide specific information on the value chain stages covered at the facility.

title: Rio Tinto invests in InoBat
notes:
Location:
- The battery research and development center and pilot battery line are located in Voderady, Slovakia. Additionally, there are plans to build a gigafactory in Serbia.

Capacity:
- The capacity of the Jadar lithium-borates project in Serbia has the potential to produce approximately 58 thousand tonnes of battery-grade lithium carbonate, which could be used to make around one million electric vehicle batteries a year.

Investment amounts:
- Rio Tinto has invested in InoBat Auto to support the completion of its research and development center and pilot battery line in Slovakia. The investment amount is not specified.

Project progress:
- Rio Tinto has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with InoBat Auto in May to work together to progress the establishment of a "cradle-to-cradle" electric vehicle battery value chain in Serbia. The Jadar lithium-borates project in Serbia is subject to receiving all relevant approvals, permits, and licenses, and ongoing engagement with local communities, the Government of Serbia, and civil society.

Project type:
- The project includes the development of a battery research and development center, a pilot battery line, and plans for a gigafactory in Serbia.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers the stages of battery research and development, pilot battery line, and potential gigafactory for battery production.

Note: Specific investment amounts were not provided in the articles. For further details on the investment, it is recommended to refer to the official sources or press releases from the companies involved.

title: Ideanomics Announces Strategic Investment with InoBat to Collaborate on EV Battery Offerings
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Voderady, Slovakia, with plans to build several gigafactories on additional sites across Europe and other global locations through 2024.

Capacity:
- The completion of InoBat’s R&D center and pilot battery plant in Voderady, Slovakia is expected by the end of 2022. The specific planned capacity is not provided.

Investment amounts:
- Ideanomics has made a strategic investment in InoBat to support the completion of its R&D center and pilot battery plant. Financial investments have also been made by Rio Tinto and Amara Raja to deliver the facility and pilot battery line.

Project progress:
- The project is currently in the phase of completing the R&D center and pilot battery plant, with plans to expand to several gigafactories across Europe and other global locations through 2024.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a pilot battery plant in Voderady, Slovakia, with plans for further expansion into gigafactories.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers the entire battery value chain, including research, development, manufacturing, and provision of premium innovative electric batteries custom-designed for various sectors.

Note: The specific capacity of the pilot battery plant and the exact amount of investment are not provided in the given information.
